name: Matthew 25:15
text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.

name: Matthew 25:16
text: Immediately he who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.

name: Matthew 25:17
text: In the same way, he also who got the two gained another two.

name: Matthew 25:18
text: But he who received the one went away and dug in the earth, and hid his lord"s money.

name: Matthew 25:19
text: "Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and reconciled accounts with them.

name: Matthew 25:20
text: He who received the five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, "Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five talents besides them."

name: Matthew 25:21
text: "His lord said to him, "Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord."

name: Matthew 25:22
text: "He also who got the two talents came and said, "Lord, you delivered to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents besides them."

name: Matthew 25:23
text: "His lord said to him, "Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord."

name: Matthew 25:24
text: "He also who had received the one talent came and said, "Lord, I knew you that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter.

name: Matthew 25:25
text: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours."

name: Matthew 25:26
text: "But his lord answered him, "You wicked and slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn"t sow, and gather where I didn"t scatter.

name: Matthew 25:27
text: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.

name: Matthew 25:28
text: Take away therefore the talent from him, and give it to him who has the ten talents.

name: Matthew 25:29
text: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have abundance, but from him who doesn"t have, even that which he has will be taken away.

name: Matthew 25:30
text: Throw out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth."

name: Matthew 25:31
text: "But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.

name: Matthew 25:32
text: Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.

name: Matthew 25:33
text: He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

name: Matthew 25:34
text: Then the King will tell those on his right hand, "Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world;

name: Matthew 25:35
text: for I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.

name: Matthew 25:36
text: I was naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me."

name: Matthew 25:37
text: "Then the righteous will answer him, saying, "Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink?

name: Matthew 25:38
text: When did we see you as a stranger, and take you in; or naked, and clothe you?

name: Matthew 25:39
text: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and come to you?"

name: Matthew 25:40
text: "The King will answer them, "Most certainly I tell you, inasmuch as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me."

name: Matthew 25:41
text: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, "Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels;

name: Matthew 25:42
text: for I was hungry, and you didn"t give me food to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me no drink;

name: Matthew 25:43
text: I was a stranger, and you didn"t take me in; naked, and you didn"t clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you didn"t visit me."

name: Matthew 25:44
text: "Then they will also answer, saying, "Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn"t help you?"

name: Matthew 25:45
text: "Then he will answer them, saying, "Most certainly I tell you, inasmuch as you didn"t do it to one of the least of these, you didn"t do it to me."

name: Matthew 25:46
text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life."

name: Matthew 26:1
text: It happened, when Jesus had finished all these words, that he said to his disciples,

name: Matthew 26:2
text: "You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified."

name: Matthew 26:3
text: Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.

name: Matthew 26:4
text: They took counsel together that they might take Jesus by deceit, and kill him.

name: Matthew 26:5
text: But they said, "Not during the feast, lest a riot occur among the people."

name: Matthew 26:6
text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

name: Matthew 26:7
text: a woman came to him having an alabaster jar of very expensive ointment, and she poured it on his head as he sat at the table.

name: Matthew 26:8
text: But when his disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying, "Why this waste?

name: Matthew 26:9
text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor."

name: Matthew 26:10
text: However, knowing this, Jesus said to them, "Why do you trouble the woman? Because she has done a good work for me.

name: Matthew 26:11
text: For you always have the poor with you; but you don"t always have me.

name: Matthew 26:12
text: For in pouring this ointment on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

name: Matthew 26:13
text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be spoken of as a memorial of her."

name: Matthew 26:14
text: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests,

name: Matthew 26:15
text: and said, "What are you willing to give me, that I should deliver him to you?" They weighed out for him thirty pieces of silver.

name: Matthew 26:16
text: From that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

name: Matthew 26:17
text: Now on the first day of unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying to him, "Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?"

name: Matthew 26:18
text: He said, "Go into the city to a certain person, and tell him, "The Teacher says, "My time is at hand. I will keep the Passover at your house with my disciples."""

name: Matthew 26:19
text: The disciples did as Jesus commanded them, and they prepared the Passover.

name: Matthew 26:20
text: Now when evening had come, he was reclining at the table with the twelve disciples.

name: Matthew 26:21
text: As they were eating, he said, "Most certainly I tell you that one of you will betray me."

name: Matthew 26:22
text: They were exceedingly sorrowful, and each began to ask him, "It isn"t me, is it, Lord?"

name: Matthew 26:23
text: He answered, "He who dipped his hand with me in the dish, the same will betray me.

name: Matthew 26:24
text: The Son of Man goes, even as it is written of him, but woe to that man through whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born."

name: Matthew 26:25
text: Judas, who betrayed him, answered, "It isn"t me, is it, Rabbi?" He said to him, "You said it."

name: Matthew 26:26
text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, gave thanks for it, and broke it. He gave to the disciples, and said, "Take, eat; this is my body."

name: Matthew 26:27
text: He took the cup, gave thanks, and gave to them, saying, "All of you drink it,

name: Matthew 26:28
text: for this is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many for the remission of sins.

name: Matthew 26:29
text: But I tell you that I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on, until that day when I drink it anew with you in my Father"s Kingdom."

name: Matthew 26:30
text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

name: Matthew 26:31
text: Then Jesus said to them, "All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, "I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered."

name: Matthew 26:32
text: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee."

name: Matthew 26:33
text: But Peter answered him, "Even if all will be made to stumble because of you, I will never be made to stumble."

name: Matthew 26:34
text: Jesus said to him, "Most certainly I tell you that tonight, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times."

name: Matthew 26:35
text: Peter said to him, "Even if I must die with you, I will not deny you." All of the disciples also said likewise.

name: Matthew 26:36
text: Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to his disciples, "Sit here, while I go there and pray."

name: Matthew 26:37
text: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and severely troubled.

name: Matthew 26:38
text: Then he said to them, "My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch with me."

name: Matthew 26:39
text: He went forward a little, fell on his face, and prayed, saying, "My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass away from me; nevertheless, not what I desire, but what you desire."

name: Matthew 26:40
text: He came to the disciples, and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, "What, couldn"t you watch with me for one hour?

name: Matthew 26:41
text: Watch and pray, that you don"t enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak."

name: Matthew 26:42
text: Again, a second time he went away, and prayed, saying, "My Father, if this cup can"t pass away from me unless I drink it, your desire be done."

name: Matthew 26:43
text: He came again and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.

name: Matthew 26:44
text: He left them again, went away, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.

name: Matthew 26:45
text: Then he came to his disciples, and said to them, "Sleep on now, and take your rest. Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

name: Matthew 26:46
text: Arise, let"s be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand."

name: Matthew 26:47
text: While he was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priest and elders of the people.

name: Matthew 26:48
text: Now he who betrayed him gave them a sign, saying, "Whoever I kiss, he is the one. Seize him."

name: Matthew 26:49
text: Immediately he came to Jesus, and said, "Hail, Rabbi!" and kissed him.

name: Matthew 26:50
text: Jesus said to him, "Friend, why are you here?" Then they came and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

name: Matthew 26:51
text: Behold, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and struck off his ear.

name: Matthew 26:52
text: Then Jesus said to him, "Put your sword back into its place, for all those who take the sword will die by the sword.

name: Matthew 26:53
text: Or do you think that I couldn"t ask my Father, and he would even now send me more than twelve legions of angels?

name: Matthew 26:54
text: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that it must be so?"

name: Matthew 26:55
text: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, "Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn"t arrest me.

name: Matthew 26:56
text: But all this has happened, that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled." Then all the disciples left him, and fled.

name: Matthew 26:57
text: Those who had taken Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.

name: Matthew 26:58
text: But Peter followed him from a distance, to the court of the high priest, and entered in and sat with the officers, to see the end.

name: Matthew 26:59
text: Now the chief priests, the elders, and the whole council sought false testimony against Jesus, that they might put him to death;

name: Matthew 26:60
text: and they found none. Even though many false witnesses came forward, they found none. But at last two false witnesses came forward,

name: Matthew 26:61
text: and said, "This man said, "I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.""

name: Matthew 26:62
text: The high priest stood up, and said to him, "Have you no answer? What is this that these testify against you?"

name: Matthew 26:63
text: But Jesus held his peace. The high priest answered him, "I adjure you by the living God, that you tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God."

name: Matthew 26:64
text: Jesus said to him, "You have said it. Nevertheless, I tell you, after this you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming on the clouds of the sky."

name: Matthew 26:65
text: Then the high priest tore his clothing, saying, "He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Behold, now you have heard his blasphemy.

name: Matthew 26:66
text: What do you think?" They answered, "He is worthy of death!"

name: Matthew 26:67
text: Then they spit in his face and beat him with their fists, and some slapped him,

name: Matthew 26:68
text: saying, "Prophesy to us, you Christ! Who hit you?"

name: Matthew 26:69
text: Now Peter was sitting outside in the court, and a maid came to him, saying, "You were also with Jesus, the Galilean!"

name: Matthew 26:70
text: But he denied it before them all, saying, "I don"t know what you are talking about."

name: Matthew 26:71
text: When he had gone out onto the porch, someone else saw him, and said to those who were there, "This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth."

name: Matthew 26:72
text: Again he denied it with an oath, "I don"t know the man."

name: Matthew 26:73
text: After a little while those who stood by came and said to Peter, "Surely you are also one of them, for your speech makes you known."

name: Matthew 26:74
text: Then he began to curse and to swear, "I don"t know the man!" Immediately the rooster crowed.

name: Matthew 26:75
text: Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said to him, "Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times." He went out and wept bitterly.

name: Matthew 27:1
text: Now when morning had come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:

name: Matthew 27:2
text: and they bound him, and led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

name: Matthew 27:3
text: Then Judas, who betrayed him, when he saw that Jesus was condemned, felt remorse, and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

name: Matthew 27:4
text: saying, "I have sinned in that I betrayed innocent blood." But they said, "What is that to us? You see to it."

name: Matthew 27:5
text: He threw down the pieces of silver in the sanctuary, and departed. He went away and hanged himself.

name: Matthew 27:6
text: The chief priests took the pieces of silver, and said, "It"s not lawful to put them into the treasury, since it is the price of blood."

name: Matthew 27:7
text: They took counsel, and bought the potter"s field with them, to bury strangers in.

name: Matthew 27:8
text: Therefore that field was called "The Field of Blood" to this day.

name: Matthew 27:9
text: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying, "They took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him upon whom a price had been set, whom some of the children of Israel priced,

name: Matthew 27:10
text: and they gave them for the potter"s field, as the Lord commanded me."

name: Matthew 27:11
text: Now Jesus stood before the governor: and the governor asked him, saying, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus said to him, "So you say."

name: Matthew 27:12
text: When he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

name: Matthew 27:13
text: Then Pilate said to him, "Don"t you hear how many things they testify against you?"

name: Matthew 27:14
text: He gave him no answer, not even one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.

name: Matthew 27:15
text: Now at the feast the governor was accustomed to release to the multitude one prisoner, whom they desired.

name: Matthew 27:16
text: They had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.

name: Matthew 27:17
text: When therefore they were gathered together, Pilate said to them, "Whom do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?"

name: Matthew 27:18
text: For he knew that because of envy they had delivered him up.

name: Matthew 27:19
text: While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent to him, saying, "Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him."

name: Matthew 27:20
text: Now the chief priests and the elders persuaded the multitudes to ask for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

name: Matthew 27:21
text: But the governor answered them, "Which of the two do you want me to release to you?" They said, "Barabbas!"

name: Matthew 27:22
text: Pilate said to them, "What then shall I do to Jesus, who is called Christ?" They all said to him, "Let him be crucified!"

name: Matthew 27:23
text: But the governor said, "Why? What evil has he done?" But they cried out exceedingly, saying, "Let him be crucified!"

name: Matthew 27:24
text: So when Pilate saw that nothing was being gained, but rather that a disturbance was starting, he took water, and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, "I am innocent of the blood of this righteous person. You see to it."

name: Matthew 27:25
text: All the people answered, "May his blood be on us, and on our children!"

name: Matthew 27:26
text: Then he released to them Barabbas, but Jesus he flogged and delivered to be crucified.

name: Matthew 27:27
text: Then the governor"s soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.

name: Matthew 27:28
text: They stripped him, and put a scarlet robe on him.

name: Matthew 27:29
text: They braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and they kneeled down before him, and mocked him, saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!"

name: Matthew 27:30
text: They spat on him, and took the reed and struck him on the head.

name: Matthew 27:31
text: When they had mocked him, they took the robe off of him, and put his clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.

name: Matthew 27:32
text: As they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name, and they compelled him to go with them, that he might carry his cross.

name: Matthew 27:33
text: They came to a place called "Golgotha," that is to say, "The place of a skull."

name: Matthew 27:34
text: They gave him sour wine to drink mixed with gall. When he had tasted it, he would not drink.

name: Matthew 27:35
text: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots,

name: Matthew 27:36
text: and they sat and watched him there.

name: Matthew 27:37
text: They set up over his head the accusation against him written, "THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS."

name: Matthew 27:38
text: Then there were two robbers crucified with him, one on his right hand and one on the left.

name: Matthew 27:39
text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads,

name: Matthew 27:40
text: and saying, "You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross!"

name: Matthew 27:41
text: Likewise the chief priests also mocking, with the scribes, the Pharisees, and the elders, said,

name: Matthew 27:42
text: "He saved others, but he can"t save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.

name: Matthew 27:43
text: He trusts in God. Let God deliver him now, if he wants him; for he said, "I am the Son of God.""

name: Matthew 27:44
text: The robbers also who were crucified with him cast on him the same reproach.

name: Matthew 27:45
text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

name: Matthew 27:46
text: About the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, "Eli, Eli, lima sabachthani?" That is, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

name: Matthew 27:47
text: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said, "This man is calling Elijah."

name: Matthew 27:48
text: Immediately one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.

name: Matthew 27:49
text: The rest said, "Let him be. Let"s see whether Elijah comes to save him."

name: Matthew 27:50
text: Jesus cried again with a loud voice, and yielded up his spirit.

name: Matthew 27:51
text: Behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom. The earth quaked and the rocks were split.

name: Matthew 27:52
text: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;

name: Matthew 27:53
text: and coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.

name: Matthew 27:54
text: Now the centurion, and those who were with him watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake, and the things that were done, feared exceedingly, saying, "Truly this was the Son of God."

name: Matthew 27:55
text: Many women were there watching from afar, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, serving him.

name: Matthew 27:56
text: Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.

name: Matthew 27:57
text: When evening had come, a rich man from Arimathaea, named Joseph, who himself was also Jesus" disciple came.

name: Matthew 27:58
text: This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus" body. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up.

name: Matthew 27:59
text: Joseph took the body, and wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

name: Matthew 27:60
text: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out in the rock, and he rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, and departed.

name: Matthew 27:61
text: Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the tomb.

name: Matthew 27:62
text: Now on the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate,

name: Matthew 27:63
text: saying, "Sir, we remember what that deceiver said while he was still alive: "After three days I will rise again."

name: Matthew 27:64
text: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, "He is risen from the dead;" and the last deception will be worse than the first."

name: Matthew 27:65
text: Pilate said to them, "You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you can."

name: Matthew 27:66
text: So they went with the guard and made the tomb secure, sealing the stone.

name: Matthew 28:1
text: Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.

name: Matthew 28:2
text: Behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from the sky, and came and rolled away the stone from the door, and sat on it.

name: Matthew 28:3
text: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing white as snow.

name: Matthew 28:4
text: For fear of him, the guards shook, and became like dead men.

name: Matthew 28:5
text: The angel answered the women, "Don"t be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus, who has been crucified.

name: Matthew 28:6
text: He is not here, for he has risen, just like he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.

name: Matthew 28:7
text: Go quickly and tell his disciples, "He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him." Behold, I have told you."

name: Matthew 28:8
text: They departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.

name: Matthew 28:9
text: As they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, "Rejoice!" They came and took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.

name: Matthew 28:10
text: Then Jesus said to them, "Don"t be afraid. Go tell my brothers that they should go into Galilee, and there they will see me."

name: Matthew 28:11
text: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city, and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.

name: Matthew 28:12
text: When they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave a large amount of silver to the soldiers,

name: Matthew 28:13
text: saying, "Say that his disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.

name: Matthew 28:14
text: If this comes to the governor"s ears, we will persuade him and make you free of worry."

name: Matthew 28:15
text: So they took the money and did as they were told. This saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continues until this day.

name: Matthew 28:16
text: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.

name: Matthew 28:17
text: When they saw him, they bowed down to him, but some doubted.

name: Matthew 28:18
text: Jesus came to them and spoke to them, saying, "All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.

name: Matthew 28:19
text: Go, and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,

name: Matthew 28:20
text: teaching them to observe all things that I commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age." Amen.

name: Mark 1:1
text: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

name: Mark 1:2
text: As it is written in the prophets, "Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.

name: Mark 1:3
text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, "Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!""

name: Mark 1:4
text: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.

name: Mark 1:5
text: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

name: Mark 1:6
text: John was clothed with camel"s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.

name: Mark 1:7
text: He preached, saying, "After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.

name: Mark 1:8
text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit."

name: Mark 1:9
text: It happened in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

name: Mark 1:10
text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

name: Mark 1:11
text: A voice came out of the sky, "You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."

name: Mark 1:12
text: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

name: Mark 1:13
text: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.

name: Mark 1:14
text: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom of God,

name: Mark 1:15
text: and saying, "The time is fulfilled, and the Kingdom of God is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News."

name: Mark 1:16
text: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.

name: Mark 1:17
text: Jesus said to them, "Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men."

name: Mark 1:18
text: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.

name: Mark 1:19
text: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.

name: Mark 1:20
text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.

name: Mark 1:21
text: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

name: Mark 1:22
text: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.

name: Mark 1:23
text: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,

name: Mark 1:24
text: saying, "Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!"

name: Mark 1:25
text: Jesus rebuked him, saying, "Be quiet, and come out of him!"

name: Mark 1:26
text: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.

name: Mark 1:27
text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, "What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!"

name: Mark 1:28
text: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

name: Mark 1:29
text: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

name: Mark 1:30
text: Now Simon"s wife"s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.

name: Mark 1:31
text: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her, and she served them.

name: Mark 1:32
text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.

name: Mark 1:33
text: All the city was gathered together at the door.

name: Mark 1:34
text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn"t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.

name: Mark 1:35
text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there.

name: Mark 1:36
text: Simon and those who were with him followed after him;

name: Mark 1:37
text: and they found him, and told him, "Everyone is looking for you."

name: Mark 1:38
text: He said to them, "Let"s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason."

name: Mark 1:39
text: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.

name: Mark 1:40
text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, "If you want to, you can make me clean."

name: Mark 1:41
text: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, "I want to. Be made clean."

name: Mark 1:42
text: When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.

name: Mark 1:43
text: He strictly warned him, and immediately sent him out,

name: Mark 1:44
text: and said to him, "See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them."

name: Mark 1:45
text: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.

name: Mark 2:1
text: When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house.

name: Mark 2:2
text: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.

name: Mark 2:3
text: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.

name: Mark 2:4
text: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

name: Mark 2:5
text: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, "Son, your sins are forgiven you."

name: Mark 2:6
text: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

name: Mark 2:7
text: "Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?"

name: Mark 2:8
text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them, "Why do you reason these things in your hearts?

name: Mark 2:9
text: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, "Your sins are forgiven;" or to say, "Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?"

name: Mark 2:10
text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins""he said to the paralytic"

name: Mark 2:11
text: "I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house."

name: Mark 2:12
text: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, "We never saw anything like this!"

name: Mark 2:13
text: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.

name: Mark 2:14
text: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him, "Follow me." And he arose and followed him.

name: Mark 2:15
text: It happened, that he was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.

name: Mark 2:16
text: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, "Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?"

name: Mark 2:17
text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them, "Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."

name: Mark 2:18
text: John"s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him, "Why do John"s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don"t fast?"

name: Mark 2:19
text: Jesus said to them, "Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can"t fast.

name: Mark 2:20
text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.

name: Mark 2:21
text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.

name: Mark 2:22
text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins."

name: Mark 2:23
text: It happened that he was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.

name: Mark 2:24
text: The Pharisees said to him, "Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?"

name: Mark 2:25
text: He said to them, "Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry"he, and those who were with him?

name: Mark 2:26
text: How he entered into the house of God when Abiathar was high priest, and ate the show bread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and gave also to those who were with him?"

name: Mark 2:27
text: He said to them, "The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

name: Mark 2:28
text: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath."

name: Mark 3:1
text: He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.

name: Mark 3:2
text: They watched him, whether he would heal him on the Sabbath day, that they might accuse him.

name: Mark 3:3
text: He said to the man who had his hand withered, "Stand up."

name: Mark 3:4
text: He said to them, "Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?" But they were silent.

name: Mark 3:5
text: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.

name: Mark 3:6
text: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

name: Mark 3:7
text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,

name: Mark 3:8
text: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.

name: Mark 3:9
text: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn"t press on him.

name: Mark 3:10
text: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.

name: Mark 3:11
text: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, "You are the Son of God!"

name: Mark 3:12
text: He sternly warned them that they should not make him known.

name: Mark 3:13
text: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.

name: Mark 3:14
text: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach,

name: Mark 3:15
text: and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:

name: Mark 3:16
text: Simon, to whom he gave the name Peter;

name: Mark 3:17
text: James the son of Zebedee; John, the brother of James, and he surnamed them Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder;

name: Mark 3:18
text: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;

name: Mark 3:19
text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. He came into a house.

name: Mark 3:20
text: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

name: Mark 3:21
text: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said, "He is insane."

name: Mark 3:22
text: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, "He has Beelzebul," and, "By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons."

name: Mark 3:23
text: He summoned them, and said to them in parables, "How can Satan cast out Satan?

name: Mark 3:24
text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

name: Mark 3:25
text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

name: Mark 3:26
text: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can"t stand, but has an end.

name: Mark 3:27
text: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.

name: Mark 3:28
text: Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;

name: Mark 3:29
text: but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin"

name: Mark 3:30
text: "because they said, "He has an unclean spirit."

name: Mark 3:31
text: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.

name: Mark 3:32
text: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, "Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you."

name: Mark 3:33
text: He answered them, "Who are my mother and my brothers?"

name: Mark 3:34
text: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, "Behold, my mother and my brothers!

name: Mark 3:35
text: For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother."

name: Mark 4:1
text: Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.

name: Mark 4:2
text: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,

name: Mark 4:3
text: "Listen! Behold, the farmer went out to sow,

name: Mark 4:4
text: and it happened, as he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.

name: Mark 4:5
text: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

name: Mark 4:6
text: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

name: Mark 4:7
text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

name: Mark 4:8
text: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some brought forth thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much."

name: Mark 4:9
text: He said, "Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear."

name: Mark 4:10
text: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.

name: Mark 4:11
text: He said to them, "To you is given the mystery of the Kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,

name: Mark 4:12
text: that "seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.""

name: Mark 4:13
text: He said to them, "Don"t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?

name: Mark 4:14
text: The farmer sows the word.

name: Mark 4:15
text: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.

name: Mark 4:16
text: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.

name: Mark 4:17
text: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.

name: Mark 4:18
text: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,

name: Mark 4:19
text: and the cares of this age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

name: Mark 4:20
text: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times."

name: Mark 4:21
text: He said to them, "Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn"t it put on a stand?

name: Mark 4:22
text: For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

name: Mark 4:23
text: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear."

name: Mark 4:24
text: He said to them, "Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.

name: Mark 4:25
text: For whoever has, to him will more be given, and he who doesn"t have, even that which he has will be taken away from him."

name: Mark 4:26
text: He said, "The Kingdom of God is as if a man should cast seed on the earth,

name: Mark 4:27
text: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he doesn"t know how.

name: Mark 4:28
text: For the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

name: Mark 4:29
text: But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts forth the sickle, because the harvest has come."

name: Mark 4:30
text: He said, "How will we liken the Kingdom of God? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?

name: Mark 4:31
text: It"s like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth,

name: Mark 4:32
text: yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow."

name: Mark 4:33
text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.

name: Mark 4:34
text: Without a parable he didn"t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.

name: Mark 4:35
text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them, "Let"s go over to the other side."

name: Mark 4:36
text: Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him.

name: Mark 4:37
text: A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled.

name: Mark 4:38
text: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him, "Teacher, don"t you care that we are dying?"

name: Mark 4:39
text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, "Peace! Be still!" The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

name: Mark 4:40
text: He said to them, "Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?"

name: Mark 4:41
text: They were greatly afraid, and said to one another, "Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?"

name: Mark 5:1
text: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

name: Mark 5:2
text: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.

name: Mark 5:3
text: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains,

name: Mark 5:4
text: because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him.

name: Mark 5:5
text: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.

name: Mark 5:6
text: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,

name: Mark 5:7
text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, "What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don"t torment me."

name: Mark 5:8
text: For he said to him, "Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!"

name: Mark 5:9
text: He asked him, "What is your name?" He said to him, "My name is Legion, for we are many."

name: Mark 5:10
text: He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

name: Mark 5:11
text: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.

name: Mark 5:12
text: All the demons begged him, saying, "Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them."

name: Mark 5:13
text: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed down the steep bank into the sea, and they were drowned in the sea.

name: Mark 5:14
text: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.

name: Mark 5:15
text: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.

name: Mark 5:16
text: Those who saw it declared to them how it happened to him who was possessed by demons, and about the pigs.

name: Mark 5:17
text: They began to beg him to depart from their region.

name: Mark 5:18
text: As he was entering into the boat, he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him.

name: Mark 5:19
text: He didn"t allow him, but said to him, "Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you."

name: Mark 5:20
text: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.

name: Mark 5:21
text: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.

name: Mark 5:22
text: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet,

name: Mark 5:23
text: and begged him much, saying, "My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live."

name: Mark 5:24
text: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.

name: Mark 5:25
text: A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years,

name: Mark 5:26
text: and had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse,

name: Mark 5:27
text: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.

name: Mark 5:28
text: For she said, "If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well."

name: Mark 5:29
text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.

name: Mark 5:30
text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked, "Who touched my clothes?"

name: Mark 5:31
text: His disciples said to him, "You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, "Who touched me?""

name: Mark 5:32
text: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.

name: Mark 5:33
text: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

name: Mark 5:34
text: He said to her, "Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease."

name: Mark 5:35
text: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler"s house saying, "Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?"

name: Mark 5:36
text: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue, "Don"t be afraid, only believe."

name: Mark 5:37
text: He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

name: Mark 5:38
text: He came to the synagogue ruler"s house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.

name: Mark 5:39
text: When he had entered in, he said to them, "Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep."

name: Mark 5:40
text: They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.

name: Mark 5:41
text: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her, "Talitha cumi!" which means, being interpreted, "Girl, I tell you, get up!"

name: Mark 5:42
text: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.

name: Mark 5:43
text: He strictly ordered them that no one should know this, and commanded that something should be given to her to eat.

name: Mark 6:1
text: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

name: Mark 6:2
text: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying, "Where did this man get these things?" and, "What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?

name: Mark 6:3
text: Isn"t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren"t his sisters here with us?" They were offended at him.

name: Mark 6:4
text: Jesus said to them, "A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house."

name: Mark 6:5
text: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people, and healed them.

name: Mark 6:6
text: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.

name: Mark 6:7
text: He called to himself the twelve, and began to send them out two by two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits.

name: Mark 6:8
text: He commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,

name: Mark 6:9
text: but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics.

name: Mark 6:10
text: He said to them, "Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.

name: Mark 6:11
text: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!"

name: Mark 6:12
text: They went out and preached that people should repent.

name: Mark 6:13
text: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

name: Mark 6:14
text: King Herod heard this, for his name had become known, and he said, "John the Baptizer has risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him."

name: Mark 6:15
text: But others said, "He is Elijah." Others said, "He is a prophet, or like one of the prophets."

name: Mark 6:16
text: But Herod, when he heard this, said, "This is John, whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead."

name: Mark 6:17
text: For Herod himself had sent out and arrested John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip"s wife, for he had married her.

name: Mark 6:18
text: For John said to Herod, "It is not lawful for you to have your brother"s wife."

name: Mark 6:19
text: Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him, but she couldn"t,

name: Mark 6:20
text: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.

name: Mark 6:21
text: Then a convenient day came, that Herod on his birthday made a supper for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.

name: Mark 6:22
text: When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady, "Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you."

name: Mark 6:23
text: He swore to her, "Whatever you shall ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom."

name: Mark 6:24
text: She went out, and said to her mother, "What shall I ask?" She said, "The head of John the Baptizer."

name: Mark 6:25
text: She came in immediately with haste to the king, and asked, "I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter."

name: Mark 6:26
text: The king was exceedingly sorry, but for the sake of his oaths, and of his dinner guests, he didn"t wish to refuse her.

name: Mark 6:27
text: Immediately the king sent out a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring John"s head, and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

name: Mark 6:28
text: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.

name: Mark 6:29
text: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

name: Mark 6:30
text: The apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and they told him all things, whatever they had done, and whatever they had taught.

name: Mark 6:31
text: He said to them, "You come apart into a deserted place, and rest awhile." For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

name: Mark 6:32
text: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.

name: Mark 6:33
text: They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.

name: Mark 6:34
text: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.

name: Mark 6:35
text: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him, and said, "This place is deserted, and it is late in the day.

name: Mark 6:36
text: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages, and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat."

name: Mark 6:37
text: But he answered them, "You give them something to eat." They asked him, "Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them something to eat?"

name: Mark 6:38
text: He said to them, "How many loaves do you have? Go see." When they knew, they said, "Five, and two fish."

name: Mark 6:39
text: He commanded them that everyone should sit down in groups on the green grass.

name: Mark 6:40
text: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.

name: Mark 6:41
text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he gave to his disciples to set before them, and he divided the two fish among them all.

name: Mark 6:42
text: They all ate, and were filled.

name: Mark 6:43
text: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.

name: Mark 6:44
text: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.

name: Mark 6:45
text: Immediately he made his disciples get into the boat, and to go ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself sent the multitude away.

name: Mark 6:46
text: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.

name: Mark 6:47
text: When evening had come, the boat was in the midst of the sea, and he was alone on the land.

name: Mark 6:48
text: Seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea, and he would have passed by them,

name: Mark 6:49
text: but they, when they saw him walking on the sea, supposed that it was a ghost, and cried out;

name: Mark 6:50
text: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them, and said to them, "Cheer up! It is I! Don"t be afraid."

name: Mark 6:51
text: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;

name: Mark 6:52
text: for they hadn"t understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

name: Mark 6:53
text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.

name: Mark 6:54
text: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized him,

name: Mark 6:55
text: and ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick, on their mats, to where they heard he was.

name: Mark 6:56
text: Wherever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and begged him that they might touch just the fringe of his garment; and as many as touched him were made well.

name: Mark 7:1
text: Then the Pharisees, and some of the scribes gathered together to him, having come from Jerusalem.

name: Mark 7:2
text: Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled, that is, unwashed, hands, they found fault.

name: Mark 7:3
text: (For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, don"t eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.

name: Mark 7:4
text: They don"t eat when they come from the marketplace, unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things, which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches.)

name: Mark 7:5
text: The Pharisees and the scribes asked him, "Why don"t your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?"

name: Mark 7:6
text: He answered them, "Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, "This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

name: Mark 7:7
text: But in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men."

name: Mark 7:8
text: "For you set aside the commandment of God, and hold tightly to the tradition of men"the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things."

name: Mark 7:9
text: He said to them, "Full well do you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.

name: Mark 7:10
text: For Moses said, "Honor your father and your mother;" and, "He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death."

name: Mark 7:11
text: But you say, "If a man tells his father or his mother, "Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban, that is to say, given to God;""

name: Mark 7:12
text: then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother,

name: Mark 7:13
text: making void the word of God by your tradition, which you have handed down. You do many things like this."

name: Mark 7:14
text: He called all the multitude to himself, and said to them, "Hear me, all of you, and understand.

name: Mark 7:15
text: There is nothing from outside of the man, that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.

name: Mark 7:16
text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!"

name: Mark 7:17
text: When he had entered into a house away from the multitude, his disciples asked him about the parable.

name: Mark 7:18
text: He said to them, "Are you thus without understanding also? Don"t you perceive that whatever goes into the man from outside can"t defile him,

name: Mark 7:19
text: because it doesn"t go into his heart, but into his stomach, then into the latrine, thus purifying all foods?"

name: Mark 7:20
text: He said, "That which proceeds out of the man, that defiles the man.

name: Mark 7:21
text: For from within, out of the hearts of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, sexual sins, murders, thefts,

name: Mark 7:22
text: covetings, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.

name: Mark 7:23
text: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man."

name: Mark 7:24
text: From there he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. He entered into a house, and didn"t want anyone to know it, but he couldn"t escape notice.

name: Mark 7:25
text: For a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.

name: Mark 7:26
text: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him that he would cast the demon out of her daughter.

name: Mark 7:27
text: But Jesus said to her, "Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children"s bread and throw it to the dogs."

name: Mark 7:28
text: But she answered him, "Yes, Lord. Yet even the dogs under the table eat the children"s crumbs."

name: Mark 7:29
text: He said to her, "For this saying, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter."

name: Mark 7:30
text: She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.

name: Mark 7:31
text: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the region of Decapolis.

name: Mark 7:32
text: They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.

name: Mark 7:33
text: He took him aside from the multitude, privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue.

name: Mark 7:34
text: Looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said to him, "Ephphatha!" that is, "Be opened!"

name: Mark 7:35
text: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.

name: Mark 7:36
text: He commanded them that they should tell no one, but the more he commanded them, so much the more widely they proclaimed it.

name: Mark 7:37
text: They were astonished beyond measure, saying, "He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear, and the mute speak!"

name: Mark 8:1
text: In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to himself, and said to them,

name: Mark 8:2
text: "I have compassion on the multitude, because they have stayed with me now three days, and have nothing to eat.

name: Mark 8:3
text: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way."

name: Mark 8:4
text: His disciples answered him, "From where could one satisfy these people with bread here in a deserted place?"

name: Mark 8:5
text: He asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" They said, "Seven."

name: Mark 8:6
text: He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground, and he took the seven loaves. Having given thanks, he broke them, and gave them to his disciples to serve, and they served the multitude.

name: Mark 8:7
text: They had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to serve these also.

name: Mark 8:8
text: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

name: Mark 8:9
text: Those who had eaten were about four thousand. Then he sent them away.

name: Mark 8:10
text: Immediately he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the region of Dalmanutha.

name: Mark 8:11
text: The Pharisees came out and began to question him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, and testing him.

name: Mark 8:12
text: He sighed deeply in his spirit, and said, "Why does this generation seek a sign? Most certainly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation."

name: Mark 8:13
text: He left them, and again entering into the boat, departed to the other side.

name: Mark 8:14
text: They forgot to take bread; and they didn"t have more than one loaf in the boat with them.

name: Mark 8:15
text: He warned them, saying, "Take heed: beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod."

name: Mark 8:16
text: They reasoned with one another, saying, "It"s because we have no bread."

name: Mark 8:17
text: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them, "Why do you reason that it"s because you have no bread? Don"t you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?

name: Mark 8:18
text: Having eyes, don"t you see? Having ears, don"t you hear? Don"t you remember?

name: Mark 8:19
text: When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?" They told him, "Twelve."

name: Mark 8:20
text: "When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?" They told him, "Seven."

name: Mark 8:21
text: He asked them, "Don"t you understand, yet?"

name: Mark 8:22
text: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him, and begged him to touch him.

name: Mark 8:23
text: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spit on his eyes, and laid his hands on him, he asked him if he saw anything.

name: Mark 8:24
text: He looked up, and said, "I see men; for I see them like trees walking."

name: Mark 8:25
text: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.

name: Mark 8:26
text: He sent him away to his house, saying, "Don"t enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village."

name: Mark 8:27
text: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples, "Who do men say that I am?"

name: Mark 8:28
text: They told him, "John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others: one of the prophets."

name: Mark 8:29
text: He said to them, "But who do you say that I am?" Peter answered, "You are the Christ."

name: Mark 8:30
text: He commanded them that they should tell no one about him.

name: Mark 8:31
text: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.

name: Mark 8:32
text: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

name: Mark 8:33
text: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said, "Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men."

name: Mark 8:34
text: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them, "Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

name: Mark 8:35
text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.

name: Mark 8:36
text: For what does it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

name: Mark 8:37
text: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?

name: Mark 8:38
text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him, when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels."

name: Mark 9:1
text: He said to them, "Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see the Kingdom of God come with power."

name: Mark 9:2
text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.

name: Mark 9:3
text: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.

name: Mark 9:4
text: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.

name: Mark 9:5
text: Peter answered Jesus, "Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let"s make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."

name: Mark 9:6
text: For he didn"t know what to say, for they were very afraid.

name: Mark 9:7
text: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, "This is my beloved Son. Listen to him."

name: Mark 9:8
text: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

name: Mark 9:9
text: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them that they should tell no one what things they had seen, until after the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

name: Mark 9:10
text: They kept this saying to themselves, questioning what the "rising from the dead" meant.

name: Mark 9:11
text: They asked him, saying, "Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?"

name: Mark 9:12
text: He said to them, "Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?

name: Mark 9:13
text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him."

name: Mark 9:14
text: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.

name: Mark 9:15
text: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.

name: Mark 9:16
text: He asked the scribes, "What are you asking them?"

name: Mark 9:17
text: One of the multitude answered, "Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit;

name: Mark 9:18
text: and wherever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and wastes away. I asked your disciples to cast it out, and they weren"t able."

name: Mark 9:19
text: He answered him, "Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me."

name: Mark 9:20
text: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

name: Mark 9:21
text: He asked his father, "How long has it been since this has come to him?" He said, "From childhood.

name: Mark 9:22
text: Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water, to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us, and help us."

name: Mark 9:23
text: Jesus said to him, "If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes."

name: Mark 9:24
text: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, "I believe. Help my unbelief!"

name: Mark 9:25
text: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him, "You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!"

name: Mark 9:26
text: Having cried out, and convulsed greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead; so much that most of them said, "He is dead."

name: Mark 9:27
text: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.

name: Mark 9:28
text: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, "Why couldn"t we cast it out?"

name: Mark 9:29
text: He said to them, "This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting."

name: Mark 9:30
text: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn"t want anyone to know it.

name: Mark 9:31
text: For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them, "The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again."

name: Mark 9:32
text: But they didn"t understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

name: Mark 9:33
text: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them, "What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?"

name: Mark 9:34
text: But they were silent, for they had disputed one with another on the way about who was the greatest.

name: Mark 9:35
text: He sat down, and called the twelve; and he said to them, "If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all."

name: Mark 9:36
text: He took a little child, and set him in their midst. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,

name: Mark 9:37
text: "Whoever receives one such little child in my name, receives me, and whoever receives me, doesn"t receive me, but him who sent me."

name: Mark 9:38
text: John said to him, "Teacher, we saw someone who doesn"t follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn"t follow us."

name: Mark 9:39
text: But Jesus said, "Don"t forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.

name: Mark 9:40
text: For whoever is not against us is on our side.

name: Mark 9:41
text: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you are Christ"s, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.

name: Mark 9:42
text: Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.

name: Mark 9:43
text: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire,

name: Mark 9:44
text: "where their worm doesn"t die, and the fire is not quenched."

name: Mark 9:45
text: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched"

name: Mark 9:46
text: "where their worm doesn"t die, and the fire is not quenched."

name: Mark 9:47
text: If your eye causes you to stumble, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into the Kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

name: Mark 9:48
text: "where their worm doesn"t die, and the fire is not quenched."

name: Mark 9:49
text: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

name: Mark 9:50
text: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another."

name: Mark 10:1
text: He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.

name: Mark 10:2
text: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him, "Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?"

name: Mark 10:3
text: He answered, "What did Moses command you?"

name: Mark 10:4
text: They said, "Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her."

name: Mark 10:5
text: But Jesus said to them, "For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.

name: Mark 10:6
text: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.

name: Mark 10:7
text: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,

name: Mark 10:8
text: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

name: Mark 10:9
text: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate."

name: Mark 10:10
text: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.

name: Mark 10:11
text: He said to them, "Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

name: Mark 10:12
text: If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery."

name: Mark 10:13
text: They were bringing to him little children, that he should touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them.

name: Mark 10:14
text: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them, "Allow the little children to come to me! Don"t forbid them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

name: Mark 10:15
text: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it."

name: Mark 10:16
text: He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them.

name: Mark 10:17
text: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, "Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?"

name: Mark 10:18
text: Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? No one is good except one"God.

name: Mark 10:19
text: You know the commandments: "Do not murder," "Do not commit adultery," "Do not steal," "Do not give false testimony," "Do not defraud," "Honor your father and mother.""

name: Mark 10:20
text: He said to him, "Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth."

name: Mark 10:21
text: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him, "One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross."

name: Mark 10:22
text: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

name: Mark 10:23
text: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, "How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!"

name: Mark 10:24
text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again, "Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

name: Mark 10:25
text: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle"s eye than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God."

name: Mark 10:26
text: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him, "Then who can be saved?"

name: Mark 10:27
