text: Jesus, looking at them, said, "With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God."

name: Mark 10:28
text: Peter began to tell him, "Behold, we have left all, and have followed you."

name: Mark 10:29
text: Jesus said, "Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,

name: Mark 10:30
text: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.

name: Mark 10:31
text: But many who are first will be last; and the last first."

name: Mark 10:32
text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him.

name: Mark 10:33
text: "Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.

name: Mark 10:34
text: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again."

name: Mark 10:35
text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying, "Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask."

name: Mark 10:36
text: He said to them, "What do you want me to do for you?"

name: Mark 10:37
text: They said to him, "Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory."

name: Mark 10:38
text: But Jesus said to them, "You don"t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?"

name: Mark 10:39
text: They said to him, "We are able." Jesus said to them, "You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;

name: Mark 10:40
text: but to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared."

name: Mark 10:41
text: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

name: Mark 10:42
text: Jesus summoned them, and said to them, "You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

name: Mark 10:43
text: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.

name: Mark 10:44
text: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.

name: Mark 10:45
text: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many."

name: Mark 10:46
text: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

name: Mark 10:47
text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, "Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!"

name: Mark 10:48
text: Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, "You son of David, have mercy on me!"

name: Mark 10:49
text: Jesus stood still, and said, "Call him." They called the blind man, saying to him, "Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!"

name: Mark 10:50
text: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.

name: Mark 10:51
text: Jesus asked him, "What do you want me to do for you?" The blind man said to him, "Rabboni, that I may see again."

name: Mark 10:52
text: Jesus said to him, "Go your way. Your faith has made you well." Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

name: Mark 11:1
text: When they drew near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,

name: Mark 11:2
text: and said to them, "Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.

name: Mark 11:3
text: If anyone asks you, "Why are you doing this?" say, "The Lord needs him;" and immediately he will send him back here."

name: Mark 11:4
text: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.

name: Mark 11:5
text: Some of those who stood there asked them, "What are you doing, untying the young donkey?"

name: Mark 11:6
text: They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go.

name: Mark 11:7
text: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.

name: Mark 11:8
text: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.

name: Mark 11:9
text: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out, "Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

name: Mark 11:10
text: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!"

name: Mark 11:11
text: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

name: Mark 11:12
text: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

name: Mark 11:13
text: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.

name: Mark 11:14
text: Jesus told it, "May no one ever eat fruit from you again!" and his disciples heard it.

name: Mark 11:15
text: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money changers, and the seats of those who sold the doves.

name: Mark 11:16
text: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.

name: Mark 11:17
text: He taught, saying to them, "Isn"t it written, "My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?" But you have made it a den of robbers!"

name: Mark 11:18
text: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.

name: Mark 11:19
text: When evening came, he went out of the city.

name: Mark 11:20
text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.

name: Mark 11:21
text: Peter, remembering, said to him, "Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away."

name: Mark 11:22
text: Jesus answered them, "Have faith in God.

name: Mark 11:23
text: For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, "Be taken up and cast into the sea," and doesn"t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.

name: Mark 11:24
text: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.

name: Mark 11:25
text: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.

name: Mark 11:26
text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions."

name: Mark 11:27
text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,

name: Mark 11:28
text: and they began saying to him, "By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?"

name: Mark 11:29
text: Jesus said to them, "I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

name: Mark 11:30
text: The baptism of John"was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me."

name: Mark 11:31
text: They reasoned with themselves, saying, "If we should say, "From heaven;" he will say, "Why then did you not believe him?"

name: Mark 11:32
text: If we should say, "From men"""they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet.

name: Mark 11:33
text: They answered Jesus, "We don"t know." Jesus said to them, "Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things."

name: Mark 12:1
text: He began to speak to them in parables. "A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the winepress, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.

name: Mark 12:2
text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.

name: Mark 12:3
text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.

name: Mark 12:4
text: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.

name: Mark 12:5
text: Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.

name: Mark 12:6
text: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, "They will respect my son."

name: Mark 12:7
text: But those farmers said among themselves, "This is the heir. Come, let"s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours."

name: Mark 12:8
text: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

name: Mark 12:9
text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.

name: Mark 12:10
text: Haven"t you even read this Scripture: "The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.

name: Mark 12:11
text: This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes"?"

name: Mark 12:12
text: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away.

name: Mark 12:13
text: They sent some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.

name: Mark 12:14
text: When they had come, they asked him, "Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don"t defer to anyone; for you aren"t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?

name: Mark 12:15
text: Shall we give, or shall we not give?" But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, "Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it."

name: Mark 12:16
text: They brought it. He said to them, "Whose is this image and inscription?" They said to him, "Caesar"s."

name: Mark 12:17
text: Jesus answered them, "Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar"s, and to God the things that are God"s." They marveled greatly at him.

name: Mark 12:18
text: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,

name: Mark 12:19
text: "Teacher, Moses wrote to us, "If a man"s brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother."

name: Mark 12:20
text: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.

name: Mark 12:21
text: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;

name: Mark 12:22
text: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.

name: Mark 12:23
text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife."

name: Mark 12:24
text: Jesus answered them, "Isn"t this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

name: Mark 12:25
text: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

name: Mark 12:26
text: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven"t you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, "I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob"?

name: Mark 12:27
text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken."

name: Mark 12:28
text: One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, "Which commandment is the greatest of all?"

name: Mark 12:29
text: Jesus answered, "The greatest is, "Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:

name: Mark 12:30
text: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength." This is the first commandment.

name: Mark 12:31
text: The second is like this, "You shall love your neighbor as yourself." There is no other commandment greater than these."

name: Mark 12:32
text: The scribe said to him, "Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he,

name: Mark 12:33
text: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices."

name: Mark 12:34
text: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, "You are not far from the Kingdom of God." No one dared ask him any question after that.

name: Mark 12:35
text: Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple, "How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?

name: Mark 12:36
text: For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, "The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.""

name: Mark 12:37
text: Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?" The common people heard him gladly.

name: Mark 12:38
text: In his teaching he said to them, "Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces,

name: Mark 12:39
text: and the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts:

name: Mark 12:40
text: those who devour widows" houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation."

name: Mark 12:41
text: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.

name: Mark 12:42
text: A poor widow came, and she cast in two small brass coins, which equal a quadrans coin.

name: Mark 12:43
text: He called his disciples to himself, and said to them, "Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury,

name: Mark 12:44
text: for they all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on."

name: Mark 13:1
text: As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, "Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!"

name: Mark 13:2
text: Jesus said to him, "Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down."

name: Mark 13:3
text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,

name: Mark 13:4
text: "Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?"

name: Mark 13:5
text: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, "Be careful that no one leads you astray.

name: Mark 13:6
text: For many will come in my name, saying, "I am he!" and will lead many astray.

name: Mark 13:7
text: "When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don"t be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.

name: Mark 13:8
text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.

name: Mark 13:9
text: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

name: Mark 13:10
text: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.

name: Mark 13:11
text: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don"t be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.

name: Mark 13:12
text: "Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

name: Mark 13:13
text: You will be hated by all men for my name"s sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.

name: Mark 13:14
text: But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains,

name: Mark 13:15
text: and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.

name: Mark 13:16
text: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.

name: Mark 13:17
text: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!

name: Mark 13:18
text: Pray that your flight won"t be in the winter.

name: Mark 13:19
text: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.

name: Mark 13:20
text: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.

name: Mark 13:21
text: Then if anyone tells you, "Look, here is the Christ!" or, "Look, there!" don"t believe it.

name: Mark 13:22
text: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.

name: Mark 13:23
text: But you watch. "Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.

name: Mark 13:24
text: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,

name: Mark 13:25
text: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.

name: Mark 13:26
text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

name: Mark 13:27
text: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.

name: Mark 13:28
text: "Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near;

name: Mark 13:29
text: even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.

name: Mark 13:30
text: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.

name: Mark 13:31
text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

name: Mark 13:32
text: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

name: Mark 13:33
text: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don"t know when the time is.

name: Mark 13:34
text: "It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.

name: Mark 13:35
text: Watch therefore, for you don"t know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;

name: Mark 13:36
text: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.

name: Mark 13:37
text: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch."

name: Mark 14:1
text: It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him.

name: Mark 14:2
text: For they said, "Not during the feast, because there might be a riot of the people."

name: Mark 14:3
text: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard"very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.

name: Mark 14:4
text: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying, "Why has this ointment been wasted?

name: Mark 14:5
text: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii, and given to the poor." They grumbled against her.

name: Mark 14:6
text: But Jesus said, "Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.

name: Mark 14:7
text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.

name: Mark 14:8
text: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.

name: Mark 14:9
text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her."

name: Mark 14:10
text: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that he might deliver him to them.

name: Mark 14:11
text: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.

name: Mark 14:12
text: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, "Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?"

name: Mark 14:13
text: He sent two of his disciples, and said to them, "Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him,

name: Mark 14:14
text: and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, "The Teacher says, "Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?""

name: Mark 14:15
text: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there."

name: Mark 14:16
text: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.

name: Mark 14:17
text: When it was evening he came with the twelve.

name: Mark 14:18
text: As they sat and were eating, Jesus said, "Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me"he who eats with me."

name: Mark 14:19
text: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, "Surely not I?" And another said, "Surely not I?"

name: Mark 14:20
text: He answered them, "It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.

name: Mark 14:21
text: For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born."

name: Mark 14:22
text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said, "Take, eat. This is my body."

name: Mark 14:23
text: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.

name: Mark 14:24
text: He said to them, "This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.

name: Mark 14:25
text: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in the Kingdom of God."

name: Mark 14:26
text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

name: Mark 14:27
text: Jesus said to them, "All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, "I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered."

name: Mark 14:28
text: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee."

name: Mark 14:29
text: But Peter said to him, "Although all will be offended, yet I will not."

name: Mark 14:30
text: Jesus said to him, "Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times."

name: Mark 14:31
text: But he spoke all the more, "If I must die with you, I will not deny you." They all said the same thing.

name: Mark 14:32
text: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples, "Sit here, while I pray."

name: Mark 14:33
text: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.

name: Mark 14:34
text: He said to them, "My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch."

name: Mark 14:35
text: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.

name: Mark 14:36
text: He said, "Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire."

name: Mark 14:37
text: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, "Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn"t you watch one hour?

name: Mark 14:38
text: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak."

name: Mark 14:39
text: Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.

name: Mark 14:40
text: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn"t know what to answer him.

name: Mark 14:41
text: He came the third time, and said to them, "Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

name: Mark 14:42
text: Arise, let us be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand."

name: Mark 14:43
text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came"and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

name: Mark 14:44
text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, "Whomever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely."

name: Mark 14:45
text: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, "Rabbi! Rabbi!" and kissed him.

name: Mark 14:46
text: They laid their hands on him, and seized him.

name: Mark 14:47
text: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.

name: Mark 14:48
text: Jesus answered them, "Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?

name: Mark 14:49
text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn"t arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled."

name: Mark 14:50
text: They all left him, and fled.

name: Mark 14:51
text: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself, over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,

name: Mark 14:52
text: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

name: Mark 14:53
text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.

name: Mark 14:54
text: Peter had followed him from a distance, until he came into the court of the high priest. He was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.

name: Mark 14:55
text: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witnesses against Jesus to put him to death, and found none.

name: Mark 14:56
text: For many gave false testimony against him, and their testimony didn"t agree with each other.

name: Mark 14:57
text: Some stood up, and gave false testimony against him, saying,

name: Mark 14:58
text: "We heard him say, "I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.""

name: Mark 14:59
text: Even so, their testimony did not agree.

name: Mark 14:60
text: The high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, "Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?"

name: Mark 14:61
text: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, "Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?"

name: Mark 14:62
text: Jesus said, "I am. You will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of the sky."

name: Mark 14:63
text: The high priest tore his clothes, and said, "What further need have we of witnesses?

name: Mark 14:64
text: You have heard the blasphemy! What do you think?" They all condemned him to be worthy of death.

name: Mark 14:65
text: Some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to beat him with fists, and to tell him, "Prophesy!" The officers struck him with the palms of their hands.

name: Mark 14:66
text: As Peter was in the courtyard below, one of the maids of the high priest came,

name: Mark 14:67
text: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him, and said, "You were also with the Nazarene, Jesus!"

name: Mark 14:68
text: But he denied it, saying, "I neither know, nor understand what you are saying." He went out on the porch, and the rooster crowed.

name: Mark 14:69
text: The maid saw him, and began again to tell those who stood by, "This is one of them."

name: Mark 14:70
text: But he again denied it. After a little while again those who stood by said to Peter, "You truly are one of them, for you are a Galilean, and your speech shows it."

name: Mark 14:71
text: But he began to curse, and to swear, "I don"t know this man of whom you speak!"

name: Mark 14:72
text: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, "Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times." When he thought about that, he wept.

name: Mark 15:1
text: Immediately in the morning the chief priests, with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.

name: Mark 15:2
text: Pilate asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" He answered, "So you say."

name: Mark 15:3
text: The chief priests accused him of many things.

name: Mark 15:4
text: Pilate again asked him, "Have you no answer? See how many things they testify against you!"

name: Mark 15:5
text: But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate marveled.

name: Mark 15:6
text: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.

name: Mark 15:7
text: There was one called Barabbas, bound with those who had made insurrection, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.

name: Mark 15:8
text: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.

name: Mark 15:9
text: Pilate answered them, saying, "Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?"

name: Mark 15:10
text: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

name: Mark 15:11
text: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should release Barabbas to them instead.

name: Mark 15:12
text: Pilate again asked them, "What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?"

name: Mark 15:13
text: They cried out again, "Crucify him!"

name: Mark 15:14
text: Pilate said to them, "Why, what evil has he done?" But they cried out exceedingly, "Crucify him!"

name: Mark 15:15
text: Pilate, wishing to please the multitude, released Barabbas to them, and handed over Jesus, when he had flogged him, to be crucified.

name: Mark 15:16
text: The soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Praetorium; and they called together the whole cohort.

name: Mark 15:17
text: They clothed him with purple, and weaving a crown of thorns, they put it on him.

name: Mark 15:18
text: They began to salute him, "Hail, King of the Jews!"

name: Mark 15:19
text: They struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and bowing their knees, did homage to him.

name: Mark 15:20
text: When they had mocked him, they took the purple off of him, and put his own garments on him. They led him out to crucify him.

name: Mark 15:21
text: They compelled one passing by, coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

name: Mark 15:22
text: They brought him to the place called Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, "The place of a skull."

name: Mark 15:23
text: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn"t take it.

name: Mark 15:24
text: Crucifying him, they parted his garments among them, casting lots on them, what each should take.

name: Mark 15:25
text: It was the third hour, and they crucified him.

name: Mark 15:26
text: The superscription of his accusation was written over him, "THE KING OF THE JEWS."

name: Mark 15:27
text: With him they crucified two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.

name: Mark 15:28
text: The Scripture was fulfilled, which says, "He was numbered with transgressors."

name: Mark 15:29
text: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads, and saying, "Ha! You who destroy the temple, and build it in three days,

name: Mark 15:30
text: save yourself, and come down from the cross!"

name: Mark 15:31
text: Likewise, also the chief priests mocking among themselves with the scribes said, "He saved others. He can"t save himself.

name: Mark 15:32
text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe him." Those who were crucified with him insulted him.

name: Mark 15:33
text: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

name: Mark 15:34
text: At the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, "Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?" which is, being interpreted, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

name: Mark 15:35
text: Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, "Behold, he is calling Elijah."

name: Mark 15:36
text: One ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave it to him to drink, saying, "Let him be. Let"s see whether Elijah comes to take him down."

name: Mark 15:37
text: Jesus cried out with a loud voice, and gave up the spirit.

name: Mark 15:38
text: The veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom.

name: Mark 15:39
text: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, "Truly this man was the Son of God!"

name: Mark 15:40
text: There were also women watching from afar, among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

name: Mark 15:41
text: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and served him; and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem.

name: Mark 15:42
text: When evening had now come, because it was the Preparation Day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,

name: Mark 15:43
text: Joseph of Arimathaea, a prominent council member who also himself was looking for the Kingdom of God, came. He boldly went in to Pilate, and asked for Jesus" body.

name: Mark 15:44
text: Pilate marveled if he were already dead; and summoning the centurion, he asked him whether he had been dead long.

name: Mark 15:45
text: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

name: Mark 15:46
text: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

name: Mark 15:47
text: Mary Magdalene and Mary, the mother of Joses, saw where he was laid.

name: Mark 16:1
text: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.

name: Mark 16:2
text: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.

name: Mark 16:3
text: They were saying among themselves, "Who will roll away the stone from the door of the tomb for us?"

name: Mark 16:4
text: for it was very big. Looking up, they saw that the stone was rolled back.

name: Mark 16:5
text: Entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were amazed.

name: Mark 16:6
text: He said to them, "Don"t be amazed. You seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen. He is not here. Behold, the place where they laid him!

name: Mark 16:7
text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, "He goes before you into Galilee. There you will see him, as he said to you.""

name: Mark 16:8
text: They went out, and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had come on them. They said nothing to anyone; for they were afraid.

name: Mark 16:9
text: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

name: Mark 16:10
text: She went and told those who had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

name: Mark 16:11
text: When they heard that he was alive, and had been seen by her, they disbelieved.

name: Mark 16:12
text: After these things he was revealed in another form to two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.

name: Mark 16:13
text: They went away and told it to the rest. They didn"t believe them, either.

name: Mark 16:14
text: Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn"t believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

name: Mark 16:15
text: He said to them, "Go into all the world, and preach the Good News to the whole creation.

name: Mark 16:16
text: He who believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who disbelieves will be condemned.

name: Mark 16:17
text: These signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new languages;

name: Mark 16:18
text: they will take up serpents; and if they drink any deadly thing, it will in no way hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover."

name: Mark 16:19
text: So then the Lord, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

name: Mark 16:20
text: They went out, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.

name: Luke 1:1
text: Since many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us,

name: Luke 1:2
text: even as those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word delivered them to us,

name: Luke 1:3
text: it seemed good to me also, having traced the course of all things accurately from the first, to write to you in order, most excellent Theophilus;

name: Luke 1:4
text: that you might know the certainty concerning the things in which you were instructed.

name: Luke 1:5
text: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zacharias, of the priestly division of Abijah. He had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.

name: Luke 1:6
text: They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord.

name: Luke 1:7
text: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years.

name: Luke 1:8
text: Now it happened, while he executed the priest"s office before God in the order of his division,

name: Luke 1:9
text: according to the custom of the priest"s office, his lot was to enter into the temple of the Lord and burn incense.

name: Luke 1:10
text: The whole multitude of the people were praying outside at the hour of incense.

name: Luke 1:11
text: An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

name: Luke 1:12
text: Zacharias was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him.

name: Luke 1:13
text: But the angel said to him, "Don"t be afraid, Zacharias, because your request has been heard, and your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.

name: Luke 1:14
text: You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth.

name: Luke 1:15
text: For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and he will drink no wine nor strong drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother"s womb.

name: Luke 1:16
text: He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord, their God.

name: Luke 1:17
text: He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, "to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children," and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to prepare a people prepared for the Lord."

name: Luke 1:18
text: Zacharias said to the angel, "How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years."

name: Luke 1:19
text: The angel answered him, "I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. I was sent to speak to you, and to bring you this good news.

name: Luke 1:20
text: Behold, you will be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things will happen, because you didn"t believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time."

name: Luke 1:21
text: The people were waiting for Zacharias, and they marveled that he delayed in the temple.

name: Luke 1:22
text: When he came out, he could not speak to them, and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple. He continued making signs to them, and remained mute.

name: Luke 1:23
text: It happened, when the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house.

name: Luke 1:24
text: After these days Elizabeth, his wife, conceived, and she hid herself five months, saying,

name: Luke 1:25
text: "Thus has the Lord done to me in the days in which he looked at me, to take away my reproach among men."

name: Luke 1:26
text: Now in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee, named Nazareth,

name: Luke 1:27
text: to a virgin pledged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. The virgin"s name was Mary.

name: Luke 1:28
text: Having come in, the angel said to her, "Rejoice, you highly favored one! The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women!"

name: Luke 1:29
text: But when she saw him, she was greatly troubled at the saying, and considered what kind of salutation this might be.

name: Luke 1:30
text: The angel said to her, "Don"t be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.

name: Luke 1:31
text: Behold, you will conceive in your womb, and bring forth a son, and will call his name "Jesus."

name: Luke 1:32
text: He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father, David,

name: Luke 1:33
text: and he will reign over the house of Jacob forever. There will be no end to his Kingdom."

name: Luke 1:34
text: Mary said to the angel, "How can this be, seeing I am a virgin?"

name: Luke 1:35
text: The angel answered her, "The Holy Spirit will come on you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore also the holy one who is born from you will be called the Son of God.

name: Luke 1:36
text: Behold, Elizabeth, your relative, also has conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.

name: Luke 1:37
text: For everything spoken by God is possible."

name: Luke 1:38
text: Mary said, "Behold, the handmaid of the Lord; be it to me according to your word." The angel departed from her.

name: Luke 1:39
text: Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Judah,

name: Luke 1:40
text: and entered into the house of Zacharias and greeted Elizabeth.

name: Luke 1:41
text: It happened, when Elizabeth heard Mary"s greeting, that the baby leaped in her womb, and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit.

name: Luke 1:42
text: She called out with a loud voice, and said, "Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!

name: Luke 1:43
text: Why am I so favored, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

name: Luke 1:44
text: For behold, when the voice of your greeting came into my ears, the baby leaped in my womb for joy!

name: Luke 1:45
text: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord!"

name: Luke 1:46
text: Mary said, "My soul magnifies the Lord.

name: Luke 1:47
text: My spirit has rejoiced in God my Savior,

name: Luke 1:48
text: for he has looked at the humble state of his handmaid. For behold, from now on, all generations will call me blessed.

name: Luke 1:49
text: For he who is mighty has done great things for me. Holy is his name.

name: Luke 1:50
text: His mercy is for generations of generations on those who fear him.

name: Luke 1:51
text: He has shown strength with his arm. He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

name: Luke 1:52
text: He has put down princes from their thrones. And has exalted the lowly.

name: Luke 1:53
text: He has filled the hungry with good things. He has sent the rich away empty.

name: Luke 1:54
text: He has given help to Israel, his servant, that he might remember mercy,

name: Luke 1:55
text: As he spoke to our fathers, to Abraham and his seed forever."

name: Luke 1:56
text: Mary stayed with her about three months, and then returned to her house.

name: Luke 1:57
text: Now the time that Elizabeth should give birth was fulfilled, and she brought forth a son.

name: Luke 1:58
text: Her neighbors and her relatives heard that the Lord had magnified his mercy towards her, and they rejoiced with her.

name: Luke 1:59
text: It happened on the eighth day, that they came to circumcise the child; and they would have called him Zacharias, after the name of the father.

name: Luke 1:60
text: His mother answered, "Not so; but he will be called John."

name: Luke 1:61
text: They said to her, "There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name."

name: Luke 1:62
text: They made signs to his father, what he would have him called.

name: Luke 1:63
text: He asked for a writing tablet, and wrote, "His name is John." They all marveled.

name: Luke 1:64
text: His mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue freed, and he spoke, blessing God.

name: Luke 1:65
text: Fear came on all who lived around them, and all these sayings were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea.

name: Luke 1:66
text: All who heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, "What then will this child be?" The hand of the Lord was with him.

name: Luke 1:67
text: His father, Zacharias, was filled with the Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying,

name: Luke 1:68
text: "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, for he has visited and worked redemption for his people;

name: Luke 1:69
text: and has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David

name: Luke 1:70
text: (as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets who have been from of old),

name: Luke 1:71
text: salvation from our enemies, and from the hand of all who hate us;

name: Luke 1:72
text: to show mercy towards our fathers, to remember his holy covenant,

name: Luke 1:73
text: the oath which he spoke to Abraham, our father,

name: Luke 1:74
text: to grant to us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies, should serve him without fear,

name: Luke 1:75
text: In holiness and righteousness before him all the days of our life.

name: Luke 1:76
text: And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways,

name: Luke 1:77
text: to give knowledge of salvation to his people by the remission of their sins,

name: Luke 1:78
text: because of the tender mercy of our God, whereby the dawn from on high will visit us,

name: Luke 1:79
text: to shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death; to guide our feet into the way of peace."

name: Luke 1:80
text: The child was growing, and becoming strong in spirit, and was in the desert until the day of his public appearance to Israel.

name: Luke 2:1
text: Now it happened in those days, that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be enrolled.

name: Luke 2:2
text: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.

name: Luke 2:3
text: All went to enroll themselves, everyone to his own city.

name: Luke 2:4
text: Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to the city of David, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David;

name: Luke 2:5
text: to enroll himself with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him as wife, being pregnant.

name: Luke 2:6
text: It happened, while they were there, that the day had come that she should give birth.

name: Luke 2:7
text: She brought forth her firstborn son, and she wrapped him in bands of cloth, and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no room for them in the inn.

name: Luke 2:8
text: There were shepherds in the same country staying in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.

name: Luke 2:9
text: Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.

name: Luke 2:10
text: The angel said to them, "Don"t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people.

name: Luke 2:11
text: For there is born to you, this day, in the city of David, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.

name: Luke 2:12
text: This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough."

name: Luke 2:13
text: Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army praising God, and saying,

name: Luke 2:14
text: "Glory to God in the highest, on earth peace, good will toward men."

name: Luke 2:15
text: It happened, when the angels went away from them into the sky, that the shepherds said one to another, "Let"s go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us."

name: Luke 2:16
text: They came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby was lying in the feeding trough.

name: Luke 2:17
text: When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child.

name: Luke 2:18
text: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.

name: Luke 2:19
text: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.

name: Luke 2:20
text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them.

name: Luke 2:21
text: When eight days were fulfilled for the circumcision of the child, his name was called Jesus, which was given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.

name: Luke 2:22
text: When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord

name: Luke 2:23
text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, "Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord"),

name: Luke 2:24
text: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, "A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons."

name: Luke 2:25
text: Behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.

name: Luke 2:26
text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord"s Christ.

name: Luke 2:27
text: He came in the Spirit into the temple. When the parents brought in the child, Jesus, that they might do concerning him according to the custom of the law,

name: Luke 2:28
text: then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,

name: Luke 2:29
text: "Now you are releasing your servant, Master, according to your word, in peace;

name: Luke 2:30
text: for my eyes have seen your salvation,

name: Luke 2:31
text: which you have prepared before the face of all peoples;

name: Luke 2:32
text: a light for revelation to the nations, and the glory of your people Israel."

name: Luke 2:33
text: Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him,

name: Luke 2:34
text: and Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, "Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against.

name: Luke 2:35
text: Yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed."

name: Luke 2:36
text: There was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,

name: Luke 2:37
text: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn"t depart from the temple, worshipping with fastings and petitions night and day.

name: Luke 2:38
text: Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem.

name: Luke 2:39
text: When they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.

name: Luke 2:40
text: The child was growing, and was becoming strong in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.

name: Luke 2:41
text: His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.

name: Luke 2:42
text: When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast,

name: Luke 2:43
text: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn"t know it,

name: Luke 2:44
text: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day"s journey, and they looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances.

name: Luke 2:45
text: When they didn"t find him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for him.

name: Luke 2:46
text: It happened after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both listening to them, and asking them questions.

name: Luke 2:47
text: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.

name: Luke 2:48
text: When they saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, "Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you."

name: Luke 2:49
text: He said to them, "Why were you looking for me? Didn"t you know that I must be in my Father"s house?"

name: Luke 2:50
text: They didn"t understand the saying which he spoke to them.
